t: For the director of music. Of David.
The*pn fool says in his heart, “There*ld is no God.” They*ln are corrupt, their deeds are vile; there*ld is no one who does good.
The*pn Lord*s looks down from heaven on*ld all mankind to*ln see if there are any who understand, any*ld who seek God.
All*ln have turned away, all have become corrupt; there*ld is no one who does good, not*ld even one.
Do*pn all these evildoers know nothing? They*pn devour my people as though eating bread; they*ld never call on the Lord.*s
But*ln there they are, overwhelmed with dread, for*ld God is present in the company of the righteous.
You*ln evildoers frustrate the plans of the poor, but*ld the Lord*s is their refuge.
Oh,*pn that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When*ld the Lord*s restores his people, let*ld Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!
